reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Bilderberg Garden Hotel for 2 nights at the beginning of a "long weekend" in Holland and Belgium. As a Dutch-tourism-rated 5 star hotel, we expected a lot, but were told later that the Dutch star ratings are based on price more than services and amenities. It is a nice hotel, but if you are expecting a "5-star experience", look elsewhere--it is not posh by any means and is probably a 3 star in all honesty. Additionally, we found the distance a little too far from the city center for our liking. The hotel is nice-enough, but does not really shine in any area nor does it endear itself to its guests.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in a quiet residential area, far from city center: not for tourists

likes.disliked: — Location was too far from both the museum quarter and the city center

reviews.title: Lovely Hotel in a lovely area
reviews.text: As we were driven to the front door, we were taken aback by the construction along the entire front of the hotel--it did not look inviting. (Hopefully, the construction will be finished for future guests as it was neither attractive nor especially quiet.

However, upon entering we found a Dutch-modern design, with inviting fresh flower arrangements throughout. Beyond the reception is a lobby bar with a cozy fireplace. We were fortunate enough to observe the pre-Christmas flowers arrangements and the Christmas themed arrangements: mid-stay, the numerous white rose arrangements were changed to red roses, and beautiful greenery and Christmas trees were on display.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room, as the hotel, was Dutch-modern by design: stark, with lots of dark-wood paneling and simple dark wood built-ins and small leather furniture. The bedding was sleek, but the sheets were rough to the touch. Additionally, there was a problem with the TV, as it tended to turn off or become unusable at times, and the luggage holder collapsed upon first use.

reviews.text: There are thoughtful touches, such as shoe-shine machines on each floor, in-room coffee service with a choice of coffees and teas, and a specific style of glass/mug for each of the beers/spirits in the mini-bar. But there are negatives, such as the below-average shower and water pressure (heat equalization), no shower curtain, and smallish bathroom.

reviews.title: Accommodating staff
reviews.text: I am extremely fussy, but I just couldn't fault anything about this Hotel - the rooms were very clean - white bed linen was gorgeous. The breakfast was superb, the staff were amazing - couldn't do enough to help. Although the location of the Hotel is 30 minutes (perhaps a little more) walk from the centre, it's not far from Museum Square and is very quiet. We thought there was no-one else staying in the Hotel! I would love to go back and stay in this Hotel. Fabulous place!

reviews.title: Great hotel
reviews.text: Stayed here on a long weekend in May. Hotel is in a quiet leafy location. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms were comfortable and quite spacious. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

reviews.title: a nice clean hotel
reviews.text: The hotel is clean and well presented. I had read a lot of the reviews on this website and was worried.

The staff are very friendly and helpful but the hotel bar and room service is pricey! A few things to be aware of..... even is you place the do not disturb sign on your door the cleaners still come in and reception phone you. I accidently left some chocolates in the mini fridge which I went back for before departing as they were a present but they had been taken by the cleaners and I was told it was my fault for leaving them! The hotel is not in the heart of Amsterdam, although it is situated in a lovely area and is only a 10 minute tram ride (number 5) to Dam Square.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel and great staff!

reviews.text: Our party paid that little bit extra for executive rooms in this impressive hotel and we weren't disappointed. Excellent rooms and excellent service. There was work taking place within the hotel but we weren't inconvenienced at all and the friendly, knowledgeable and helpful staff made our stay even more memorable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A few weeks later I got a letter stating they had made an additional charge to my credit card for a bill they claim was unpaid. I had in fact paid this bill with cash, and returned the receipt unsigned to the lady on the till stating I wanted to pay by cash, assuming that by not signing the payment it would not go through. She seemed happy with this, but as it transpired, that cash never made it into the till (according to the hotel). As a result, they made a charge to my Visa card without authorisation - a transaction Visa upheld.
